thread.title: Tennessee offers local OL after junior day
thread.title_full: Tennessee offers local OL after junior day

title: Tennessee offers local OL after junior day
text:
Tennessee offers local OL after junior day A local offensive lineman received an offer from Tennessee on Monday. Slot to Tennessee Links (Photo: John Brice, 247Sports) 
Three-star junior offensive lineman Ollie Lane of Gibbs High School in Corryton, Tenn., posted on his Twitter account Monday that he received a scholarship offer from Tennessee. 
The offer came less than 48 hours after the 6-foot-5, 280-pound Lane visited the Vols to attend their first junior day of the year. (What's next for the Vols? Make sure you're in the loop — take five seconds to sign up for our FREE Vols newsletter now!) 
" Extremely blessed to say I have received a offer to play football for the University of Tennessee," he tweeted. 
Extremely blessed to say I have received a offer to play football for the University of Tennessee @UTCoachJones @UTWWells @UTCoachLScott pic.twitter.com/OQZn5aWElM — Oliver Lane (@gibbseagles78) February 20, 2017 
Lane also holds offers from Virginia Tech, Wisconsin, Missouri, Vanderbilt, Memphis and Northwestern. He's ranked the nation's No. 603 overall prospect and No. 29 offensive guard in the 247Sports Composite for the 2018 class. Get VIP access to GoVols247 with a FREE 7-DAY TRIAL . Author
